result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Oscar Trevino

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Oscar Trevino in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:41 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 
All files heard: 15CF110, 15CF179, 14CT277, 15CM106

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF110 Count 1 - NO CONTEST
14CT277 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF110 Count 1, 14CT277.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Dismissed & read-in: 15CF110 Counts 2 & 3, 15CF179 & 15CM106 in their entirety. 
 
Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Barkley makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
14CT277 -
Serve 30 days jail. 
Allowed to serve the entire period on Home Monitor if he qualifies. 
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report within 24 hours for start date.
Pay fine of $250 plus costs.  To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan and comply with the plan. 

15CF110 Count 1 - 
Serve 9 months jail - STAYED -
Electronic monitoring allowed on one half of the remaining sentence he has if he qualifies after a new assessment. 
Placed on probation for a period of 2 years:
Serve 90 days jail. 
May serve that on Electronic Monitoring, concurrent with 14CT277, if he qualifies for that program.  
Obtain AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to controlled substances. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Use only 1 pharmacy to obtain controlled substances. 
Sign any releases agent needs to monitor. 
Maintain fulltime employment
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Provide a DNA sample. 
Pay costs including the DNA and drug abuse surcharges. 
Court will allow early discharge if he has met all conditions and the agent recommends.

ADDRESS INFO for Oscar Trevino
Current: 2816 Rice St, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 05-26-2015)
Prior: 2816 Rice Street, Stevens Point, WI
Pre-trial conference on May 11, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Comply with all conditions set forth in all other bonds.  Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Defendant Oscar Trevino in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CM-106 and 15TR-334.

9:18 AM Court calls cases.
Address of Defendant is verified.

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.
Defendant received a copy of the complaint, has no questions.
Defendant will not be represented by a lawyer.
Court informs Defendant of right to counsel/public defender's office.
Defendant works.
Court questions Defendant further.
Court finds Defendant is waiving his right to counsel.

Court enters NOT GUILTY pleas on behalf of Defendant, not waiving time limits.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 10:00 am.
